attributes.action: ask David Milliband of DEFRA to respond to Mr Hepplewhite's questions - see below - to him concerning the safety of feathers in duvets.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Sent: 08 February 2007 21:11
To: 'david.miliband@defra.gsi.gov.uk'

Subject: Avian Flu: Down filled Duvets


Given the apparent link - per the BBC News page - between Hungarian Geese and the current UK outbreak in Turkeys I am particularly keen to hear your thoughts on this question of imported goose feathers.
When can I hope to hear from you please?
Your silence is worrying!
 
Bernie Hepplewhite

From: Bernie Hepplewhite 
Sent: 04 February 2007 22:56
To: 'david.miliband@defra.gsi.gov.uk'

Subject: Avian Flu: Down filled Duvets


David
 
I have just bought a Hungarian Goose Down Duvet...from M & S.
Bird Flu is, I now learn, present in Hungarian geese. 
 
Am I at any risk? 
 
What is your view on the risks attaching to imported down and feathers ..has this been looked into? 
 
 Thanks.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
